commit_message:
Add validation test in identity v3 test_role

Add validation to test:
- test_grant_revoke_role_to_group_on_project

Change-Id: Ie4d07972ac09bd7e4f9b8b860355eb2ab1140494
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/33/80933/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import exceptions @attr(type='smoke') def test_validation_of_grant_revoke_role_to_group_on_project(self): # Create project in domain, and grant role to group on project resp, project = self.client.create_project( data_utils.rand_name('Pro-'), domain_id=self.domain['id']) self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_project, project['id']) resp, _ = self.client.assign_group_role_on_project( project['id'], self.group_body['id'], self.role['id']) # Create a user, add it to group u_name = data_utils.rand_name("user-") u_pass = data_utils.rand_name("pwd-") resp, user = self.client.create_user( u_name, password=u_pass, domain_id=self.domain['id']) self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_user, user['id']) self.client.add_group_user(self.group_body['id'], user['id']) # Insure user has role on project p_name = project['name'] d_name = self.domain['name'] resp, body = self.token.auth(user['id'], u_pass, p_name, domain=d_name) roles = body['token']['roles'] self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '201') self.assertEqual(len(roles), 1) self.assertEqual(roles[0]['id'], self.role['id']) # Revoke role to group on project resp, _ = self.client.revoke_role_from_group_on_project( project['id'], self.group_body['id'], self.role['id']) self.assertRaises(exceptions.Unauthorized, self.token.auth, user['id'], u_pass, p_name, domain=d_name)

subject: Check attach-detach FIP & get FIP pool attributes
commit_message:
Check attach-detach FIP & get FIP pool attributes

This patch adds the JSON schema for get Floating IPs pools
and attach & detach Floating IP APIs response and validate
the response with added JSON schema to block the backward
incompatibility change in the future.

attch, detach & delete Floating IPs does not return any
response body. So only response code is being validated.

The response body of get Floating IP pools API is below:

{
    "floating_ip_pools": [
        {
            "name": "pool1"
        }
    ]
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I540b6c72fdcb6b568adbef72f5b2423a038bac7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/31/80531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: floating_ip_pools = { 'status_code': [200], 'response_body': { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'floating_ip_pools': { 'type': 'array', 'items': { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'name': {'type': 'string'} }, 'required': ['name'] } } }, 'required': ['floating_ip_pools'] } } add_remove_floating_ip = { 'status_code': [202] }

commit_message:
Validate list_keypair attribute of Nova V2/V3 APIs

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response of Nova V2 & V3
list_keypair APIs and validate the response with added JSON Schema to
block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of V2 & V3 list_keypairs APIs is same and given below:

{
    "keypairs": [
        {
            "keypair": {
                "public_key": "ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAADAQABAAABAQD
                              nPe3MJhEwcQNGZpYRaGYTwY9D9L3pr1c+eqJIP99

                              cbHS6W72xs6bmEhqxyjSLQK5fuHE1MgCCDPTd0vq
                              XdbLnCZ6+l0I8lpDhd Generated by Nova\n",
                "name": "test_key",
                "fingerprint": "52:53:dd:89:6a:73:c6:18:87:4b:1e:c1:4c
                               :b8:c3:c9"
            }
        },
        {
            "keypair": {
                "public_key": "ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAADAQABAAABAQC
                              9E3tf6msdTyVcytQrs882e4aX3Zhkp1ELIAowspL
                              OykUbzq21+0JALCxMkUxXig2GCF3jomfWez1frhG
                              o+Qj/ZgdwJG44k1ZzLswPZn5k5SMQzROTsnzDLXX
                              f95q6fWZLlfAbF7MA/wd/d/7oBmmrTfaiV27Xq9B8

commit_message:
Removes use of timeutils.set_time_override

The set_time_override function in timeutils was written as a
helper function to mock utcnow for unittests before 'mock' was
generally used. Now that we have mock and fixture, we no longer
need to use it.

Change-Id: I203f7369943b948e0462becbddcba65b2d1576f0
Partial-Bug: #1266962
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/68/73168/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock @mock.patch.object(timeutils, 'utcnow') def test_succeed(self, mock_utcnow): mock_utcnow.return_value = datetime.datetime.utcnow() @mock.patch.object(timeutils, 'utcnow') def test_fail(self, mock_utcnow): mock_utcnow.return_value = datetime.datetime.utcnow()
deleted_lines: def test_succeed(self): timeutils.set_time_override() timeutils.clear_time_override() def test_fail(self): timeutils.set_time_override() timeutils.clear_time_override()

commit_message:
Map network_name value to a bridge attribute when using vif vmware

When using vif vmware, we create networks in Openstack by naming
them with the port group names created in vCenter. Then the
network name is assigned to the bridge attribute when we boot
instance using vCenter prot groups. By parsing the bridge attribute,
nova component can get which port group should be used in this booting
instance operation.

For implementing these, on nova side, we drop the commit including:
1. Define a new vif type for VMware named VIF_TYPE_VMWARE
2. When using vif vmware, the bridge attribute is assigned with
a network name so that it is representing a port group name.

Closes-Bug: #1284559
Implements: blueprint vcenter-neutron-agent

Change-Id: Iad64a88baea0777ce4a47841ceda6f851fe0fb13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/76452/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add rally-api support to devstack

Add functions to run rally-api service under devstack and
stop the service on unstack. Add start and stop functions
to startup script for rally.

Change-Id: I4063235db3a0f72f8ab02509fe4c7b003540f2e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/05/67805/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function start_rally() { screen_it rally "cd $RALLY_DIR && $RALLY_BIN_DIR/rally-api --config-file $RALLY_CONF_DIR/$RALLY_CONF_FILE" } function stop_rally() { screen -S $SCREEN_NAME -p rally -X kill }

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-03 00:56:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/taskflow/commit/6b6d6720d30a954bfa0b57b9c82ee93e4e2e9ed9', 'message': 'Add a claim+job -> engine listener

In order to connect a job to an engine a
new listener is now returned from the claim()
method. This listener can be associated with
an engine and on state-changes of that engine
and its associated flows and tasks the listener
will ensure that the claim is still upheld.

By default when the claim is not upheld the engine
will automatically be suspended (and the job
abandoned). This suspending can be overriden by
providing a custom on_job_loss functor to the
returned listener to enable more advanced recovery
concepts.

commit_message:
Add a claim+job -> engine listener

In order to connect a job to an engine a
new listener is now returned from the claim()
method. This listener can be associated with
an engine and on state-changes of that engine
and its associated flows and tasks the listener
will ensure that the claim is still upheld.

By default when the claim is not upheld the engine
will automatically be suspended (and the job
abandoned). This suspending can be overriden by
providing a custom on_job_loss functor to the
returned listener to enable more advanced recovery
concepts.

Implements: blueprint job-reference-impl

Change-Id: I12f9c833396aa4e27dcb7831aaa4fa3dd057b5a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/85/59585/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class _ClaimWatcher(object): def __init__(self, job, board, owner): self._job = job self._board = board self._listen_states = ( states.FAILURE, states.REVERTING, states.RUNNING, states.SUCCESS, states.RESUMING, ) self._owner = owner @staticmethod def _suspend_engine_on_loss(state, details, job): details['engine'].suspend() def _claim_checker(self, state, details, handlers): if state in (states.SUSPENDING, states.SUSPENDED, states.RESUMING): return lost = False try: if (self._job.state in (states.LOST, states.UNCLAIMED) or self._job.owner != self._owner): lost = True except (excp.JobNotFound, excp.InvalidJobOperation): lost = True if not lost: return # NOTE(harlowja): Immediately suspend the engine and attempt to # interact with the jobboard to abandon the work being done (this # allows another entity to attempt to unsuspend and reacquire that # work). LOG.warn("Job %s:%s has lost its claimed, automatic abandonment" " commencing", self._job.name, self._job.uuid) on_job_loss = handlers.get('on_job_loss') if on_job_loss is None: on_job_loss = self._suspend_engine_on_loss on_job_loss(state, details, self._job) try: self._board.abandon(self._job, self._owner) except (excp.JobNotFound, excp.InvalidJobOperation): LOG.exception("Unable to automatically abandon job %s:%s", self._job.name, self._job.uuid) def associate(self, engine, on_job_loss=None): handlers = { # NOTE(harlowja): provide a custom functor to be able to do more # sophisticated operations when a claim has been lost. The default # just suspends the engine. 'on_job_loss': on_job_loss, } for s in self._listen_states: engine.notifier.register(s, self._claim_checker, kwargs={'handlers': handlers}) engine.task_notifier.register(s, self._claim_checker, kwargs={'handlers': handlers}) def disassociate(self, engine): for s in self._listen_states: engine.notifier.deregister(s, self._claim_checker) engine.task_notifier.deregister(s, self._claim_checker) return _ClaimWatcher(job, self, who)

subject: Make hacking error messages more informative
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-25 07:56:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ea878c03047f286c54a09a034eddf31e9109ed9a', 'message': "Add telling the solution when assert*() check errors occur

We get an error message when we use assert*() incorrectly.
For example when we use 'assertEqual(A, None)', the error message is
 'N318: assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A) sentences not
        allowed'
This message tells the violation but don't tell the solution. So
developers needs to find the answer through HACKING.rst.
This commit adds the solution to the error message.
And also, this commit fixes some inconsistency in the message and
HACKING.rst.

Change-Id: Ifb524cf95a452a0cd461e2ceea16efe226f13b43

commit_message:
Make hacking error messages more informative

We get an error message when we use assert*() incorrectly.
For example when we use 'assertEqual(A, None)', the error message is
 'N318: assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A) sentences not
        allowed'
This message tells the violation but don't tell the solution. So
developers needs to find the answer through HACKING.rst.
This commit adds the messages to solve the errors.
And also, this commit fixes some inconsistency in the message and
HACKING.rst.

Change-Id: Ifb524cf95a452a0cd461e2ceea16efe226f13b43
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/76114/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: assertIsInstance(A, B). assertIsNone(A).

commit_message:
Add MONGO_DEB variable to config Mongo version

Now all gating machines are installed with very old Mongo. We need to configure this
for creating gating jobs on new MongoDB for Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I048bbc5ea69a2ebfa4b717f70605147e51b84733

commit_message:
Fixes ambiguous cli output between "None" and NoneType

Print hyphen(-) in python client output when attribute value is not
set so that it is distinguishable when "None" string is set and when
no attribute value is specified.

Change-Id: I72c01191dcb1f0b83ea3e950452e1599aaed6520
Closes-Bug: #1266414

commit_message:
Add test case for cinder snapshot

When creating/updating snapshot, should ensure that they
can work if display_name and display_description contain
specific characters or exist duplicated params, so add
these cases.

Change-Id: I439b1e4189da22e5f73eaeaea88dfdda3d88752d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/10/65210/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_snapshot_create_update_with_specific_characters(self): # Create and update a snapshot which display_name and # display_description contain specific_characters s_name = '@#$%^* name' desc = '@#$%^* description' snapshot = self.create_snapshot(self.volume_origin['id'], display_name=s_name, display_description=desc) # Get the snap and check for some of its details resp, snap_get = self.snapshots_client.get_snapshot(snapshot['id']) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(self.volume_origin['id'], snap_get['volume_id'], "Referred volume origin mismatch") # Compare also with the output from the list action tracking_data = (snapshot['id'], snapshot['display_name']) resp, snaps_list = self.snapshots_client.list_snapshots() self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) snaps_data = [(f['id'], f['display_name']) for f in snaps_list] self.assertIn(tracking_data, snaps_data) # Updates snapshot with new values new_s_name = '@#$%^* new name' new_desc = '@#$%^* new description' resp, update_snapshot = \ self.snapshots_client.update_snapshot(snapshot['id'], display_name=new_s_name, display_description=new_desc) # Assert response body for update_snapshot method self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(new_s_name, update_snapshot['display_name']) self.assertEqual(new_desc, update_snapshot['display_description']) # Assert response body for get_snapshot method resp, updated_snapshot = \ self.snapshots_client.get_snapshot(snapshot['id']) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(new_s_name, updated_snapshot['display_name']) self.assertEqual(new_desc, updated_snapshot['display_description']) # Delete the snapshot self.snapshots_client.delete_snapshot(snapshot['id']) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.snapshots_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(snapshot['id']) self.snapshots.remove(snapshot) @attr(type='gate') def test_snapshot_create_update_with_duplicated_params(self): # Create and update snapshots with exist display_name and # display_description s_name = data_utils.rand_name('snap') desc = data_utils.rand_name('desc') snapshot1 = self.create_snapshot(self.volume_origin['id'], display_name=s_name, display_description=desc) #Create a snapshot with same display_name and display_description snapshot2 = self.create_snapshot(self.volume_origin['id'], display_name=s_name, display_description=desc) # Updates snapshot1 with exist values in snapshot2 resp, update_snapshot = \ self.snapshots_client.update_snapshot(snapshot1['id'], display_name=s_name, display_description=desc) # Assert response body for update_snapshot method self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(s_name, update_snapshot['display_name']) self.assertEqual(desc, update_snapshot['display_description']) # Delete the snapshots for snapshot in [snapshot1, snapshot2]: self.snapshots_client.delete_snapshot(snapshot['id']) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.snapshots_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(snapshot['id']) self.snapshots.remove(snapshot) @attr(type='gate')

commit_message:
Add cassandra-driver dependency

This is going to be required for the Ceilometer storage backend using
Cassandra.

Licensed under Apache License 2.0.
No Python 3 support for now, but since it's a driver, it's self
contained in Ceilometer.

Change-Id: If74edbc3845d361807f6365d62414ae036e70894
Blueprint: cassandra-driver

commit_message:
Add proxy middleware for server-side encryption

Change-Id: If75f068d9fc1389b2428c0dce588946be93b21d0
Implements: blueprint swift-enc-proxy
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/78/76578/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2010-2012 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """ Encryption Proxy Middleware The ``enc-proxy`` middleware provides server-side encryption for the objects stored in Swift. Encryption is enabled on a container level, i.e. all objects in a container will be encrypted if the encryption is enabled for the container upon its creation. This is done using the "X-Container-Meta-Encrypt-Enabled" header. Also, the user may specify a default encryption algorithm for the container, also at creation time, using "X-Container-Meta-Encrypt-Default"; if none is provided, the container encryption algorithm is set according to the configuration settings. Currently, all objects within a container will be encrypted with the default encryption algorithm, though a per-object algorithm support can trivially be added at later time if needed. Each object is encrypted with a per-object key and IV value. The object key is wrapped with a higher key. The wrapped key and other object-specific values are stored in the object system metadata (N.B. system metadata is not yet supported for objects, hence using regular metadata for now). Keys are organised in a hierarchy which can be either a simple one, i.e. one account key to wrap all object keys, or a full direct hierarchy, in which an account key is used to wrap all the keys for all of its containers and each container key wraps all object keys for the objects stored in the container. Regardless, of the hierarchy choice, which need to support a few methods -- see enc_proxy/key_hierarchy_base.py -- and can be set as a configuration option, the account key is wrapped with a corresponding master key which resides in a master key manager. The ``enc-proxy`` middleware uses a key manager to store its master keys. One such key manager is Barbican, which will be the preferred choice as it is an Openstack project, though the specific choice should be left a configuration setting. The key manager needs to support only wrapping/unwrapping of an account key given an authentikation toke. Check out enc_proxy/key_manager_base.py for further details. The ``enc-proxy`` uses a crypto interface for the required cryptographic operations like key generation, encryption, decryption, and context creation and serialization. There are several options for the underlying crypto library, e.g., PyCrypto, M2Crypto, and others, hence that the exact choice might also be left as a configuration option. The default choice is PyCrypto due its license and use in other Openstack projects. See also: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift/server-side-enc """ import sys from hashlib import md5 from swift.common.swob import wsgify, Request, HTTPException, HTTPServerError from swift.common.utils import (config_true_value, split_path, get_logger, cache_from_env) from enc_proxy.key_manager_base import KeyManager from enc_proxy.crypto_base import CryptoInterface from enc_proxy.key_hierarchy_base import KeyHierarchy, derive_path class SwiftEnc(object): """ Encryption Proxy Middleware Add to enc-proxy to your pipeline in proxy-server.conf as well as: [filter:proxy_enc] use = egg:swift#enc_proxy default_enc_alg = aes_128_cfb crypto_interface = \ swift.common.middleware.enc_proxy.crypto_py:CryptoPY key_manager = \ ... .enc_proxy.key_manager_barbican:DummyKeyManager hierarchy_implementation = \ ... .enc_proxy.key_hierarchy_direct:DirectHierarchy :param app: The next WSGI app in the pipeline :param conf: The dict of configuration values """ def __init__(self, app, conf): self.app = app self.logger = get_logger(conf, log_route="enc_proxy") crypto = conf.get("crypto_interface", "missing-conf-crypto") self.crypto = instantiate_derived_class(CryptoInterface, crypto, conf) self.default_enc_alg = conf.get("default_enc_alg", "aes_128_cfb") mkm = conf.get("key_manager", "missing-conf-mkm") self.mkm = instantiate_derived_class(KeyManager, mkm, conf, self.crypto) hrchy = conf.get("hierarchy_implementation", "missing-conf-hrchy") self.hrchy = instantiate_derived_class(KeyHierarchy, hrchy, conf, self.crypto, self.mkm) def __call__(self, env, start_response): """ Accepts a standard WSGI call and proceed according the request. For a container, if PUT and encryption is enabled, we need to initiliaze the container key and set the appropraite system metadata if a first PUT for the given container (response w/ 201). Otherwise, we set the header values inidicating whether the container is encrypted based on sysmeta. Object requests proceed according to the type: PUT: if the container has encryption enabled, create an object key and proceed accordingly; the wrapped key and encryption context are stored as object system metadata together with the plaintext tag (de-etag) and size (de-etag). The wrapped key header entry depends on the container name as described on the wiki page. GET: if the object is encrypted, decrypt and check the encryption tag(s) POST: noting if obj-systmeta is implemented; otherwise, preserve the enc_proxy object headers HEAD: replace en-etag and en-size with de-etag and de-size in the response headers COPY: get the object key rewrapped with the target container key and POST it; then do a regular COPY. """ self.hrchy.init_cache(env) req = Request(env) path_ver, path_acc, path_cont, path_obj = \ split_path(req.path, 1, 4, False) # Container if path_acc and path_cont and not path_obj: if req.method == "PUT": return self.app_cont_init(env, start_response) else: return self.app_cont_resp(env, start_response) # Object if path_acc and path_cont and path_obj: if req.method == "GET": return self.app_obj_decrypt(env, start_response) elif req.method == "PUT": return self.app_obj_encrypt(env, start_response) elif req.method == "COPY": return self.app_obj_copy(env, start_response) return self.app_obj_resp(env, start_response) return self.app(env, start_response) @wsgify def app_cont_init(self, req): """ Initialize a container. Only if a first PUT for the container set the "cont-sys-enc" and "cont-sys-alg" system metadata values based on the headers set by the user. """ header_name = self.hrchy.header_name("cont-meta-enc") if config_true_value(req.headers.get(header_name)): req.headers[self.hrchy.header_name("cont-meta-enc")] = "" resp = req.get_response(self.app) if resp.status_int == 201: enc_alg = \ req.headers.get(self.hrchy.header_name("cont-meta-alg"), self.default_enc_alg) self.hrchy.init_container(req.headers["X-Auth-Token"], self.app, req.path, enc_alg) resp.headers[self.hrchy.header_name("cont-meta-enc")] = "On" resp.headers[self.hrchy.header_name("cont-meta-alg")] = \ enc_alg return resp else: return req.get_response(self.app) @wsgify def app_cont_resp(self, req): """ Set the "cont-meta-enc" and "cont-meta-alg" header values in the response headers based on the system metadata entries. """ resp = req.get_response(self.app) if self.hrchy.header_name("cont-sys-enc") in resp.headers.keys(): resp.headers[self.hrchy.header_name("cont-meta-enc")] = "On" resp.headers[self.hrchy.header_name("cont-meta-alg")] = \ resp.headers.get(self.hrchy.header_name("cont-sys-alg")) return resp @wsgify def app_obj_resp(self, req): """ Default response for object requests which are not PUT, GET, COPY """ #TODO: preserve object sysmeta headers for POST resp = req.get_response(self.app) #TODO: update response headers return resp @wsgify def app_obj_encrypt(self, req): """ PUT for an object. Four metadata entries are set for each object: "obj-sys-enc-key": the wrapped object key "obj-sys-enc-context": the encryption context for the object, e.g. IV and enc. algorithm "obj-sys-de-etag": the etag before the object is encrypted "obj-sys-de-size": the object size before encryption """ #TODO: reimplement for partial reads and validity tags enc_alg = self.get_cont_enc_alg(req.path) if enc_alg: name_suffix = md5(derive_path(req.path, 3)).hexdigest().lower() obj_key, obj_key_wrapped = \ self.hrchy.create_obj_key(req.headers["X-Auth-Token"], self.app, req.path, enc_alg) obj_context = self.crypto.create_context(enc_alg) new_headers = { self.hrchy.header_name("obj-sys-enc-key", name_suffix): obj_key_wrapped, self.hrchy.header_name("obj-sys-enc-context"): self.crypto.serialize_context(obj_context), self.hrchy.header_name("obj-sys-de-etag"): md5(req.body).hexdigest(), self.hrchy.header_name("obj-sys-de-size"): req.headers["Content-Length"]} req.headers.update(new_headers) req.body = \ self.crypto.encrypt(obj_key, req.body, obj_context, False) return req.get_response(self.app) def get_cont_enc_alg(self, path): """ Check whether a container has encryption enabled and return the encryption algorithm if so. """ cont_path = derive_path(path, 3) new_env = {"CONTENT_LENGTH": 0, "REQUEST_METHOD": "HEAD"} new_req = Request.blank(cont_path, environ=new_env) resp = new_req.get_response(self.app) if not resp.is_success: raise HTTPServerError("Unable to retrieve headers") cont_headers = dict((k.lower(), v) for (k, v) in resp.headers.iteritems()) if self.hrchy.header_name("cont-sys-enc") in cont_headers.keys(): return cont_headers.get(self.hrchy.header_name("cont-sys-alg"), self.default_enc_alg) else: return None @wsgify def app_obj_copy(self, req): """ COPY for an object """ raise NotImplementedError("soon") return resp def app_obj_decrypt(self, env, start_response): """ GET for an object. Decrypt an object, check the validty tags and adjust the response headers with the system metadata values set during the PUT. """ #TODO: reimplement for partial reads and validity check req = Request(env) decrypt_ok = [] cipher_context = {} def start_decrypt(status, resp_headers, exc_info=None): del decrypt_ok[:] if (self.hrchy.header_name("obj-sys-enc-context").lower() in map(lambda (n, v): n.lower(), resp_headers)): cipher_context.clear() obj_key, obj_context = \ self.hrchy.get_obj_key(req.headers["X-Auth-Token"], self.app, req.path) cipher_context["key"] = obj_key cipher_context["iv"] = obj_context.get("iv") cipher_context["alg"] = obj_context.get("alg") cipher_context["tag"] = obj_context.get("tag") decrypt_ok.append(True) resp_headers = self.adjust_resp_obj_headers(resp_headers) write = start_response(status, resp_headers, exc_info) if decrypt_ok: def write_decrypt(data): write(self.crypto.decrypt(cipher_context["key"], data, cipher_context, False)) return write_decrypt else: return write return DecryptIter(self.app(env, start_decrypt), self.crypto, cipher_context, decrypt_ok) def adjust_resp_obj_headers(self, headers): de_etag = self.hrchy.header_name("obj-sys-de-etag") de_size = self.hrchy.header_name("obj-sys-de-size") adj_headers = filter(lambda (n, v): n.lower not in ["content-length", "etag"], headers) def map_fn((n, v)): if n.lower() == de_etag.lower(): return ("etag", v) elif n.lower() == de_size.lower(): return ("content-length", v) else: return (n, v) return map(map_fn, adj_headers) class DecryptIter(object): """ Return an iterable that yields decrypted HTTP response body. """ def __init__(self, result, crypto, cipher_context, decrypt_ok): if hasattr(result, "close"): self.close = result.close self._next = iter(result).next self.crypto = crypto self.cipher_context = cipher_context self.decrypt_ok = decrypt_ok def __iter__(self): return self def next(self): data = self._next() if self.decrypt_ok: return self.crypto.decrypt(self.cipher_context["key"], data, self.cipher_context, False) else: return data def instantiate_derived_class(base_class, config_entry, *args, **kwargs): """ Instantiate a base class with a derived class specified in the config with the provided parameters. """ try: derived_module, derived_class = config_entry.split(":") __import__(derived_module) derived_class = getattr(sys.modules[derived_module], derived_class) if issubclass(derived_class, base_class): return derived_class(*args, **kwargs) else: raise ValueError() except (ImportError, AttributeError, ValueError): raise ImportError("Cannot derive %s from base class %s" % (config_entry, base_class.__name__)) def filter_factory(global_conf, **local_conf): conf = global_conf.copy() conf.update(local_conf) def swiftenc_filter(app): return SwiftEnc(app, conf) return swiftenc_filter

commit_message:
Re-use requests connections pool

Each requests.Session manage a connections pool by it self and to
take advantage of this connections pool which should only create
one instance of requests.Session.

Change-Id: I6f5e8b458ff9624d3673250b02031f66725a2872
Closes-Bug: #1282089

commit_message:
Enforce required parameters for trusts

When creating trusts without 'impersonation' specified in the request,
it is possible to receive an exception from the backend, such as a MySQL
error 'Column "impersonation" cannot be null'. This check should be
handled in the controllers so that the behavior is consistent across all
backends.

Change-Id: Ie9b7aaf5891ccdbb7015295e827b7e981c253dfb
Closes-Bug: 1278739

subject: Fix incorrect usage of unicode string
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-18 07:14:13.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_setup.py', 'pbr/packaging.py', 'requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/commit/9ec93d3b5b9dc39f288d3caa5616d038b8093bfc', 'message': 'Fix incorrect usage of unicode string

There's use of u'' / u"" strings in PBR which are incompatible
with Python 3.2, which makes it difficult to backport the package
to Wheezy. This patch uses six to fix it.

Change-Id: I3d266d432de8209bd5009fe24fea6cfbd1132f5a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect usage of unicode string

There's use of u'' / u"" strings in PBR which are incompatible
with Python 3.2, which makes it difficult to backport the package
to Wheezy. This patch uses six to fix it.

Change-Id: I3d266d432de8209bd5009fe24fea6cfbd1132f5a

commit_message:
Fixing DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message

Accessing BaseException message attribute is deprecated since py2.6,
it cases huge cinder log files on the gate runs.

Change-Id: Iaa4b92e86f50d8d9fb6091535246ff08aa3a7ed2
Partial-Bug: #1257530

added_lines: for pattern in _DUP_KEY_RE_DB[engine_name]: match = pattern.match("".join(integrity_error.args)) m = re.match("".join(operational_error.args))

commit_message:
Use multiprocessing in UserGenerator for deleting tenants and users

Delete each tenant and its users in separate thread to save performance.
Single keystone client is used for each thread

Blueprint concurrent-creation-of-users

Change-Id: I54a102e0e093fbbbd6646a4a925253f24d401516
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/32/78632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import multiprocessingfrom rally import osclientsPATTERN_TENANT = "temp_%(run_id)s_tenant_%(iter)i" PATTERN_USER = "%(tenant_id)s_user_%(uid)d" def create_tenant_users(args): """Create tenant with users and their endpoints. This is suitable for using with multiprocessing. :param args: tuple with real arguments """ admin_endpoint, users_per_tenant, run_id, i = args users = [] client = osclients.Clients(admin_endpoint).get_keystone_client() tenant = client.tenants.create(PATTERN_TENANT % {"run_id": run_id, "iter": i}) for user_id in range(users_per_tenant): username = PATTERN_USER % {"tenant_id": tenant.id, "uid": user_id} user = client.users.create(username, "password", "%s@email.me" % username, tenant.id) endpoint_ = endpoint.Endpoint(client.auth_url, user.name, "password", tenant.name, consts.EndpointPermission.USER) users.append({"id": user.id, "endpoint": endpoint_}) return ({"id": tenant.id, "name": tenant.name}, users) def __init__(self, context, concurrent=50): self.concurrent = concurrent """Create tenants and users, using multiprocessing""" pool_args = [(self.context["admin"]["endpoint"], self.config["users_per_tenant"], run_id, i)\ for i in range(self.config["tenants"])] pool = multiprocessing.Pool(self.concurrent) data = pool.imap(create_tenant_users, pool_args) pool.close() pool.join() for tenant, users in data: self.context["tenants"].append(tenant) self.context["users"] += users """Delete users and tenants after scenario is finished""" client = osclients.Clients(self.context["admin"]["endpoint"]).get_keystone_client() client.users.delete(user["id"]) client.tenants.delete(tenant["id"])
deleted_lines: from rally import osclients def __init__(self, context): clients = osclients.Clients(context["admin"]["endpoint"]) self.keystone_client = clients.get_keystone_client() def _create_user(self, user_id, tenant_id): pattern = "%(tenant_id)s_user_%(uid)d" name = pattern % {"tenant_id": tenant_id, "uid": user_id} email = "%s@email.me" % name return self.keystone_client.users.create(name, "password", email, tenant_id) def _create_tenant(self, run_id, i): pattern = "temp_%(run_id)s_tenant_%(iter)i" return self.keystone_client.tenants.create(pattern % {"run_id": run_id, "iter": i}) auth_url = self.keystone_client.auth_url self.context["tenants"] = [] for i in range(self.config["tenants"]): tenant = self._create_tenant(run_id, i) self.context["tenants"].append({"id": tenant.id, "name": tenant.name}) for tenant in self.context["tenants"]: for user_id in range(self.config["users_per_tenant"]): user = self._create_user(user_id, tenant["id"]) epoint = endpoint.Endpoint(auth_url, user.name, "password", tenant["name"], consts.EndpointPermission.USER) self.context["users"].append({"id": user.id, "endpoint": epoint}) self.keystone_client.users.delete(user["id"]) self.keystone_client.tenants.delete(tenant["id"])

commit_message:
add bp:rest-clients-return-obj

this is a small blueprint on a change to the way rest clients
would work for discussion. It is also a first attempt at using
the qa-specs repository.

Change-Id: Ica57ec7790f28c670986c4fec2b000de4f9472c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/76/81276/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Rest Clients should return single value ======================================= Problem ------- The current tempest code assumes rest clients are returning a tuple which is the same as returned by httplib2. This leads to a lot of zeroing out one or the other value because we don't use it in tests. :: tempest(master)> grep -r ' _[, ]' tempest | wc -l 267 About 90% of those are real uses here. Proposed Solution ----------------- Create a single object return from our rest clients. Embed the httplib2.Response as the ``resp`` attribute of this new response object. Map __getattr__ to make a call into the dictionary for that object, so that we'd have code that looks like follows:: resp = self.client.assign_user_role_on_project( self.project['id'], self.user_body['id'], self.role['id']) self.assertEqual(resp.status, '204') Instead of the existing:: resp, _ = self.client.assign_user_role_on_project( self.project['id'], self.user_body['id'], self.role['id']) self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '204')

commit_message:
Lowercase OVS sample config section headers

The "Sample Configurations" section of ovs_neutron_plugin.ini
has uppercased section headers.  In Havana the section headers
were normalized to lowercase, but the sample configs were never
updated.

Change-Id: Ic33392788317adcd6eb86caeef4f25aa4a3d10c8
Closes-Bug: #1279418
(cherry picked from commit 0048b2e83f8deaef4ae8f453215cd8eb85e83e66)

subject: Config generator: handle options in multiple groups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 19:30:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/4eb8a154415006ef06a3baafa3fc2147fe54f595', 'message': 'Config generator: handle options in multiple groups

The commit 7c18261df5609d689a32c697c77c0a97512342bc disabled detection
of duplicate options in the same group, by comparing for equality rather
than identity. This had the effect of breaking the case where the same
option appeared in different groups, as it would always match the first
group the option appeared in, and thus show up only in that group.

This fixes the problem by only comparing for equality in the default
group. This is the place where it is most likely for duplicate options
to be registered in multiple different places. (It remains an open
question whether this should be allowed at all, or if bug 1262148 should
be fixed instead by eliminating duplicate options.) If duplicate options
are registered in any other group the original error-checking behaviour
will apply, since this ought never to happen.

Closes-bug: #1288586
Change-Id: Ie8753fbe84258e88b5a41fa7dccb45c224c69bde
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-14 21:38:32.000000000', 'files': ['tests/testmods/baar_baa_opt.py', 'openstack/common/config/generator.py', 'tests/unit/config/test_generator.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/8e06ea3ed45fad23a3b21cfbef89263a2c85c39f', 'message': 'Config generator: handle options in multiple groups

The commit 7c18261df5609d689a32c697c77c0a97512342bc disabled detection
of duplicate options in the same group, by comparing for equality rather
than identity. This had the effect of breaking the case where the same
option appeared in different groups, as it would always match the first
group the option appeared in, and thus show up only in that group. It
also had the affect that any options registered multiple times would
show up multiple times in one group in the output.

This fixes the problem by only matching on the identical object, while
still recognising if an equivalent option is registered and avoiding
raising the exception that caused bug 1262148 when that is the case.

Closes-bug: #1288586
Change-Id: Ie8753fbe84258e88b5a41fa7dccb45c224c69bde
'}]
commit_message:
Config generator: handle options in multiple groups

The commit 7c18261df5609d689a32c697c77c0a97512342bc disabled detection
of duplicate options in the same group, by comparing for equality rather
than identity. This had the effect of breaking the case where the same
option appeared in different groups, as it would always match the first
group the option appeared in, and thus show up only in that group. It
also had the affect that any options registered multiple times would
show up multiple times in one group in the output.

This fixes the problem by only matching on the identical object, while
still recognising if an equivalent option is registered and avoiding
raising the exception that caused bug 1262148 when that is the case.

Closes-bug: #1288586
Change-Id: Ie8753fbe84258e88b5a41fa7dccb45c224c69bde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/38/79738/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Don't register memcached_server option in two groups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-19 01:50:59.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/9ae7305739864b5dae62f5e3b2c303bac33e837b', 'message': 'Don't register memcached_server option in two groups

The auth_token middleware registers the option "memcached_servers" in
the "keystone_authtoken" group. However, by virtue of importing
keystoneclient.openstack.common.memorycache, the option is also
registered in the default group.

This can cause problems with duplicate copies of the openstack.common
code in other projects importing this.  It's also confusing for the
user (in many cases they will end up with two places in the config file
where the option can appear).

Fix this by unregistering the option from the default group, and
passing the actual option group we want as the config source to
memorycache.get_client().

Closes-bug: 1262148

Change-Id: Ic8f6c6ac0f254e0deb919b66cb36cddfe8b1a378
'}]
commit_message:
Don't register memcached_server option in two groups

The auth_token middleware registers the option "memcached_servers" in
the "keystone_authtoken" group. However, by virtue of importing
keystoneclient.openstack.common.memorycache, the option is also
registered in the default group.

This can cause problems with duplicate copies of the openstack.common
code in other projects importing this.  It's also confusing for the
user (in many cases they will end up with two places in the config file
where the option can appear).

Fix this by unregistering the option from the default group, and
passing the actual option group we want as the config source to
memorycache.get_client().

Closes-bug: 1262148

Change-Id: Ic8f6c6ac0f254e0deb919b66cb36cddfe8b1a378
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/15/81415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Unregister memcache_opts from DEFAULT group, since we have registered them # separately in the keystone_authtoken group above. CONF.unregister_opts(memorycache.memcache_opts) self._cache = memorycache.get_client(memcache_servers, conf=CONF.keystone_authtoken)

commit_message:
serial-console: Use udev rules to startup getty

Update the systemd serial port element implementation
so that it uses udev rules. Much nicer than
hard coding ttyS0 and ttyS1.

The udev rule only adds real serial device types
(i.e. == 4). See:

  define TTY_DRIVER_TYPE_SERIAL 0x0003

from include/linux/tty_driver.h.

Change-Id: I5d7de4815fd09c01693b7da4b8949f22fee20745

commit_message:
Use --nodes for setup-baremetal in toci_devtest

The old-style method for specifying nodes to setup-baremetal of passing
the JSON datafile along with --first or --not-first will be removed
soon. Switch the setup-baremetal call to the new-style of --nodes.

Change-Id: I0bfcbab455aeb5c386d3b548e255dad546fb6d44

commit_message:
Default to 30G of disk per bm VM.

Turns out that uncompressed disk images take up space, and full
disks lead to deploy failures. Who knew!

Change-Id: If05df11c56ffd40aeb8b39561429321ec235bd96

commit_message:
Removed unnecessary test from account test

Swift does not provide any api by which user can create
and delete metadata for account simultaneously.

Closes-Bug: #1297167

Change-Id: Ia1d1cc169e80f76142e15b1c7cc8081e8bb69479
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/35/82835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_update_account_metadata_with_create_and_delete_metadata(self): # Send a request adding and deleting metadata requests simultaneously metadata_1 = {'test-account-meta1': 'Meta1'} self.account_client.create_account_metadata(metadata_1) metadata_2 = {'test-account-meta2': 'Meta2'} resp, body = self.account_client.create_and_delete_account_metadata( metadata_2, metadata_1) self.assertIn(int(resp['status']), test.HTTP_SUCCESS) self.assertHeaders(resp, 'Account', 'POST') resp, _ = self.account_client.list_account_metadata() self.assertNotIn('x-account-meta-test-account-meta1', resp) self.assertIn('x-account-meta-test-account-meta2', resp) self.assertEqual(resp['x-account-meta-test-account-meta2'], metadata_2['test-account-meta2']) self.account_client.delete_account_metadata(metadata_2)

commit_message:
Only create a tmpfs big enough for DIB_MIN_TMPFS

This will help to ensure images that would cause bug #1289582 would
still fail even on systems that have more RAM. Also this will ensure we
only reserve enough tmpfs space for this build.

Change-Id: Icece64e691d126a5fc89262897630fdbef1ffdf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/74/79074/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo mount -t tmpfs tmpfs -o size=$(($DIB_MIN_TMPFS*2))G $TMP_BUILD_DIR

commit_message:
Create pip manifest files of installed packages

Create the pip-manifest element to encapsulate the saving and use
of pip manifest files.

Ensure that it installs prior to any elements that should be able
to use it.

Write pip manifest files for installs in:
    * os-svc-install
    * os-apply-config
    * os-collect-config
    * os-refresh-config
    * openstack-clients

Enable using a manifest file to reinstall exact versions of
packages in a subsequent run through the DIB_PIP_MANIFEST_*
environment variables.

Change-Id: I4d4ab5921c534727b48cb9969ec8ecfd2c26e6ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/44/80644/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip-manifest

commit_message:
Adding image update policy to undercloud template

Allows image policy to be specified when updating the undercloud
stack. This enables the preservation of persistent ephemeral disks.

Change-Id: Id7bc0a72ae1737d2fdadb3f47006bd0cfb0bc42f
Closes-Bug: #1295616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/66/82066/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ImageUpdatePolicy: Default: REPLACE Description: What policy to use when reconstructing instances. REBUILD for rebuilds, REBUILD_PRESERVE_EPHEMERAL to preserve /mnt. Type: String image_update_policy: Ref: ImageUpdatePolicy

commit_message:
Define 'links' as a common parameter type

Nova APIs contain a lot of 'links' parameter and the definitions of
each API are the same. This patch adds a common type for 'links' and
shares it between APIs for the maintenancebility.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I9609a9cadb0a7edd707fe57e76b3d629a0b3f8bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/00/82400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.api_schema.compute import parameter_types 'links': parameter_types.links, 'links': parameter_types.links

commit_message:
Verify the list volume attributes of Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for volume list and
validate the response of Nova Volume list APIs with
added JSON schema to block the backward incompatibility
change in the future.

The response body of Nova APIs volume list-'os-volumes'
& volume list details-'os-volumes/detail' is the below:

{
    "volumes": [
        {
            "id": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803",
            "status": "in-use",
            "displayName": "Volume Name",
            "availabilityZone": "zone1:host1",
            "createdAt": "1999-01-01T01:01:01",
            "displayDescription": "Volume Description"
            "volumeType": "Backup",
            "snapshotId": null,
            "metadata": {},
            "size": 100,
            "attachments": [
                {
                    "id": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803",
                    "device": "/",
                    "volumeId": "a287c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803",
                    "serverId": "3912f4-c5ba-4aec-9165-872876fe202e"
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I97bb6310a6fcb7d475dbd2bc53814d38c5e9c173

added_lines: def _verify_attach_volume_attributes(self, volume): # Verifying the Volume attributes which are fetched by # "POST- os-volume_attachments" APIs for key in ('device', 'serverId', 'id', 'volumeId'): self.assertIn(key, volume) resp, _ = self.servers_client.detach_volume(server_id, volume_id) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) resp, _ = self.volumes_client.delete_volume(self.volume['id']) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) resp, body = self.servers_client.attach_volume( server['id'], volume['id'], device='/dev/%s' % self.device) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) #Verify the response attributes to confirm the backward compatibility self._verify_attach_volume_attributes(body) resp, _ = self.servers_client.stop(server['id']) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) resp, _ = self.servers_client.start(server['id']) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) resp, _ = self.servers_client.stop(server['id']) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) resp, _ = self.servers_client.start(server['id']) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status)

commit_message:
Set the worker timeout

Use the value for DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT to set the worker timeout of the
test environment.

Change-Id: I68f0cb8e1852270f70639063e463a25eb4d969e0

subject: Kill commands that outlive test env
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-21 13:03:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/cdc3c08e74f811d92be6ab38bec668994cd80ba3', 'message': "Gracefully handle commands that outlive test env

There is a timeout on the test env worker, once it is passed the gearman
job is cancelled. Since testenv-client is waiting for the thread running
the command to complete before exiting we may as well wait until it is
complete before reading the exit value.

This case should be avoided as it means we are running a command against
a testenv that is now longer exclusively under our control, I'll also
submit a corresponding commit to the testenv-worker to increase its
timeout above the jenkins timeout avoiding this case completely.

commit_message:
Kill commands that outlive test env

There is a timeout on the test env worker, once it is passed the gearman
job is cancelled. If this occurs and testenv-client is waiting for the
thread running the command to complete, we kill everything in the process
group.

Change-Id: I629fdd8f17bc95274dbad11465b2653514dc5e7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/02/75402/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time self.rv = None # Ensure the thread running the command has completed before we read the # value of cb.rv, this covers the case where the testenv-worker has timed # out and released the environment. We no longer have exclusive control # of the test environment but if the command succeeds we may as well use # the correct result. while cb.rv == None: logger.warn("The command hasn't completed but the testenv worker has " "released the environment.") time.sleep(5)

commit_message:
Fix availability-zone option miss when creates an instance

In test_availability_zone.py the availability-zone option is
used as 'availability_zone' which should be modified to
'os-availability-zone:availability_zone'.

Change-Id: I765d07b699ecb425dadccb22af834b11f52ff5b0
Closes-Bug: #1270811
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/67825/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Change libvirt close callback to use green thread
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 14:47:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6a3bad1091ed17f91d0f8462bb82629c2aef4790', 'message': "Change libvirt close callback to use green thread for status update

The native thread that polls libvirt for events is being used to update a host's
status, potentially causing threading issues, since it involves operations
that should only be performed by green threads. This changes fixes the issue
by limiting the native thread's interaction to the setting of an instance
attribute and leaving the remaining work for a green thread.

Closes bug 1290487

commit_message:
Change libvirt close callback to use green thread

The native thread that calls the close callback is being
used to update a host's status, potentially causing threading
issues, since it involves operations that should only be
performed by green threads. This change fixes the issue
by limiting the native thread's interaction to adding data
to a queue and leaving the remaining work for
a green thread.

Closes-Bug: #1290487
Closes-Bug: #1293641

Change-Id: I59c14da15e4655dc4bf21d4de3d509472b146f7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/79617/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: close_event_conn = None def _connection_close_thread(self): """Processes async connection close events coming in from libvirtd. This is a green thread which processes connection close events from the libvirt event loop thread. When the _close_callback method is called by the native thread that runs the default libvirt event loop implementation, it sets the close_event_conn instance attribute. """ while True: if self.close_event_conn is None: continue with self._wrapped_conn_lock: if self.close_event_conn != self._wrapped_conn: continue _error = _("Connection to libvirt lost: %s") % reason LOG.warn(_error) self._wrapped_conn = None # Disable compute service to avoid # new instances of being scheduled on this host. self._set_host_enabled(False, disable_reason=_error) self.close_event_conn = None LOG.debug(_("Starting green dispatch threads")) eventlet.spawn(self._connection_close_thread) self.close_event_conn = conn
deleted_lines: LOG.debug(_("Starting green dispatch thread")) with self._wrapped_conn_lock: if conn == self._wrapped_conn: _error = _("Connection to libvirt lost: %s") % reason LOG.warn(_error) self._wrapped_conn = None # Disable compute service to avoid # new instances of being scheduled on this host. self._set_host_enabled(False, disable_reason=_error)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-05 11:34:32.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/ceilometer/manifests/init.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nova/manifests/init.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cinder/manifests/base.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/a8e0849d6e90b3395aa2281fb03d011e0591b403', 'message': 'Fix ensure log_config is absent regression

This fixes a regression what was introduced
with the minor refactoring patch
(79c5bbba98458d2e7db80d0797b6b7991703cb7a).

W/o this patch nova, cinder and ceilometer would not be

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix ensure log_config is absent regression

This fixes a regression what was introduced
with the minor refactoring patch
(79c5bbba98458d2e7db80d0797b6b7991703cb7a).

W/o this patch nova, cinder and ceilometer would not be
re-configured, if debug=true was re-set in astute.yaml

Change-Id: I6b00646893eee27d35e5d1c67c0082d6f8dc0029
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/72/78172/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'DEFAULT/log_config': ensure=> absent;

Add a method for changing a user's password in V3

resource for changing user's password added in keystone.

Change-Id: Iaf0e4ab369dc1b69f75fd7cb07065f667bfcec5b
Closes-Bug: #1239757
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/14/59914/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_password(self, user, origpassword=None, password=None): """Update password.""" params = {"user": {"password": password, "original_password": origpassword}} base_url = '/users/%s/password' % base.getid(user) return self._update(base_url, params, response_key="access", method="POST", management=False)

commit_message:
Make OS::Nova::Server networks property updatable

This patch adds the ability to update the networks property.
Update process consists of two simple steps:
    1. detaching all old interfaces
    2. attaching all new interfaces.

Change-Id: Iaabf8be1adc6cb7d5ecc08edb92d9f9ce029b125
Closes-bug: #1250645
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/99/74299/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ), update_allowed=True if self.NETWORKS in prop_diff: new_networks = prop_diff.get(self.NETWORKS) existed_networks = [getattr(net, 'id') for net in self.nova().networks.list()] server = self.nova().servers.get(self.resource_id) interfaces = server.interface_list() # according nova interface-detach command detached port # will be deleted for iface in interfaces: server.interface_detach(getattr(iface, 'port_id')) for net in new_networks: if net.get('port'): server.interface_attach(net['port'], None, None) if net.get('network'): if net['network'] in existed_networks: server.interface_attach(None, net['network'], net.get('fixed_ip')) else: logger.error(_('Network %(net)s does not exist') % {'net': net['network']})

commit_message:
Fixed unit test to not actually run backup command

One unit tests is still trying to execute the actual backup command
instead of the mocked backup command. This is causing an issue on
the Jenkins slave where it is trying to run as sudo (and failing).
Fixed the test to use a mock runner, and not try to run innobackupex.

Change-Id: Ifff7945be158a08167cdd282ed8eb18952224eee
Closes-bug: 1291516
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/42/81142/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not add current tenant to private flavor access

Avoid adding the current tenant to the flavor access list when
a private flavor is created. In ordeir to add tenants to the
flavor access list we should use the add_tenant api.

Tempest has to be updated accordingly:
https://review.openstack.org/81551

Documentation has to be updated as well:
https://review.openstack.org/82175

Partially (just for the V2 API rather than V2 and V3)
reverts commit 6ba248635b70860a44e486e7739efa4cc6612ce6

Fixes unittest which was added in the original commit so it checks
for the behaviour we have now rather than the behaviour after the
backwards incompatible change which is being reverted.

Change-Id: I731081b6df0d96df1bc1763d214d28c62bbbb51c
Closes-Bug: #1286297

commit_message:
Discover should support other services

Most services don't provide a 'values' element for their version
definitions, however are otherwise similar. Discovery should allow that
case and continue on otherwise.

Change-Id: I878377a779da5c96c47603842c024059920423fd

added_lines: import sixCINDER_EXAMPLES = { "versions": [ { "status": "CURRENT", "updated": "2012-01-04T11:33:21Z", "id": "v1.0", "links": [ { "href": "%sv1/" % BASE_URL, "rel": "self" } ] }, { "status": "CURRENT", "updated": "2012-11-21T11:33:21Z", "id": "v2.0", "links": [ { "href": "%sv1/" % BASE_URL, "rel": "self" } ] } ] } GLANCE_EXAMPLES = { "versions": [ { "status": "CURRENT", "id": "v2.2", "links": [ { "href": "%sv2/" % BASE_URL, "rel": "self" } ] }, { "status": "SUPPORTED", "id": "v2.1", "links": [ { "href": "%sv2/" % BASE_URL, "rel": "self" } ] }, { "status": "SUPPORTED", "id": "v2.0", "links": [ { "href": "%sv2/" % BASE_URL, "rel": "self" } ] }, { "status": "CURRENT", "id": "v1.1", "links": [ { "href": "http://%sv1/" % BASE_URL, "rel": "self" } ] }, { "status": "SUPPORTED", "id": "v1.0", "links": [ { "href": "http://%sv1/" % BASE_URL, "rel": "self" } ] } ] } examples = {'a': V3_VERSION_LIST, 'b': jsonutils.dumps(CINDER_EXAMPLES), 'c': jsonutils.dumps(GLANCE_EXAMPLES)} for path, ex in six.iteritems(examples): url = "%s%s" % (BASE_URL, path) httpretty.register_uri(httpretty.GET, url, status=300, body=ex) versions = discover.available_versions(url) for v in versions: self.assertIn('id', v) self.assertIn('status', v) self.assertIn('links', v)

commit_message:
Change router's prop name agent_id to l3_agent_id

Currently, the OS::Neutron::Router supports associating the L3Agent via
"agent_id" property.

However, Neutron supports a few kind of agents(L3, DHCP and etc).
The property name of "agent_id" is little bit ambiguous.

It's nice to change property name "agent_id" to "l3_agent_id".

Change-Id: Ie3c90d703df81bbf9d541a7d7c08641eed9c8e2a
Closes-bug: #1296608

commit_message:
fix the extension of README in etc/nova

the file is a text file, not a conf file, this change prevents
accidental parsing (and erroring) when setting config_dir=etc/nova

Change-Id: I35c35e812736908858aad235fb173beaf74f74bb

commit_message:
Make initialization test failure more explicit

A few changes to make the db initialization test failure mode more
explicit.

Change-Id: I533cd33476a57ecb854a1af1a5fb170c65daa825
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/88/82688/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception as e: self.assertTrue(hasattr(e, 'path')) self.assertEquals(e.path, ':memory:') self.assertTrue(hasattr(e, 'msg')) self.assertEquals(e.msg, "DB doesn't exist") else: self.fail("Expected an uninitialized exception")
deleted_lines: got_exc = False except Exception: got_exc = True self.assert_(got_exc)

subject: Add neutron_port resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-25 23:54:41.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/neutron_port.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_port/neutron.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_router_interface/neutron.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/neutron_router_interface.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/73ce984ccc2a66620ab2dbc117fdcb4135df46cc', 'message': 'Add neutron_port resource

This resource is required to add more than a single router interface to
a neutron network or subnet. By default, using
`neutron_router_interface` to add a second router to a subnet without
first creating a port for it will cause IP conflicts.

This resource can be used to first retreive a non-conflicting ip on a
target network or subnet, then create a `neutron_router_interface` with
the port.

Eg:
```
neutron_router { $tenant:
  tenant_name          => $tenant,
  gateway_network_name => 'public',
  require              => [
    Neutron_network['private'],
    Neutron_subnet[$private_subnet],
  ],
} ->
neutron_port { "${tenant}_private":
  ensure       => present,
  network_name => 'private',
  subnet_name  => $private_subnet,
} ->
neutron_router_interface  { "${tenant}:${private_subnet}":
  ensure => present,
  port   => ${tenant}_private",
}
```

Change-Id: I06a2186224c4c4fb59c6906152fed720c4cfc374
'}]
commit_message:
Add neutron_port resource

This resource is required to add more than a single router interface to
a neutron network or subnet. By default, using
`neutron_router_interface` to add a second router to a subnet without
first creating a port for it will cause IP conflicts.

This resource can be used to first retreive a non-conflicting ip on a
target network or subnet, then create a `neutron_router_interface` with
the port.

Eg:
```
neutron_router { $tenant:
  tenant_name          => $tenant,
  gateway_network_name => 'public',
  require              => [
    Neutron_network['private'],
    Neutron_subnet[$private_subnet],
  ],
} ->
neutron_port { "${tenant}_private":
  ensure       => present,
  network_name => 'private',
  subnet_name  => $private_subnet,
} ->
neutron_router_interface  { "${tenant}:${private_subnet}":
  ensure => present,
  port   => ${tenant}_private",
}
```

Change-Id: I06a2186224c4c4fb59c6906152fed720c4cfc374
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/49/82949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: newproperty(:port) do desc 'An existing neutron port to which a rounter interface should be assigned' end

subject: Run periodic_task in a with a dynamic timer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-24 21:34:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/9896b1dedbbee4c4efa07c5e678b0f4e664b0509', 'message': 'Set good defaults for heartbeat interval & timeout

In openstack.common.periodic, a periodic task has an effective minimum
of a 60 second interval. Due to this, running tests caused a race
condition where a heartbeat might not occur in time for the test to
pass.

This changes the default heartbeat_interval to 60 seconds to more
closely reflect the reality of how often it runs. I also raised the
heartbeat_timeout to 90 seconds to allow plenty of time for the
heartbeat to be recieved and processed before failing the test.

Change-Id: I17a270ecbb5fd53149a89816f4be1c9a0c27b541
Closes-Bug: 1295874
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-24 21:39:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/65b68250f0bbf57f06320eadd463cb24ad92bd1c', 'message': 'Set good defaults for heartbeat interval & timeout

In openstack.common.periodic, a periodic task has an effective minimum
of a 60 second interval. Due to this, running tests caused a race
condition where a heartbeat might not occur in time for the test to
pass.

This changes the default heartbeat_interval to 60 seconds to more
closely reflect the reality of how often it runs. I also raised the
heartbeat_timeout to 90 seconds to allow plenty of time for the
heartbeat to be recieved and processed before failing the test.

Change-Id: I17a270ecbb5fd53149a89816f4be1c9a0c27b541
Closes-Bug: 1295874
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-25 00:04:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/4e80dd43ab36bb47ad1b4326049d4d9e432d578e', 'message': "Set good defaults for heartbeat interval & timeout

In openstack.common.periodic, a periodic task has an effective minimum
of a 60 second interval. Due to this, running tests caused a race
condition where a heartbeat might not occur in time for the test to
pass.

This changes the default heartbeat_interval to 60 seconds to more
closely reflect the reality of how often it runs. I also raised the
heartbeat_timeout to 150 seconds since 2.5x interval is a reasonable
production setting for a heartbeat_timeout.

However, in testing, we want tests to fail if a single heartbeat fails,
so I've configured tests to use a timeout of 90 seconds.

Change-Id: I17a270ecbb5fd53149a89816f4be1c9a0c27b541
Closes-Bug: 1295874
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-25 16:23:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/0f9b3e9222c3a0c2eb70089562820dff0cad239d', 'message': "Set good defaults for heartbeat interval & timeout

In openstack.common.periodic, a periodic task has an effective minimum
of a 60 second interval. Due to this, running tests caused a race
condition where a heartbeat might not occur in time for the test to
pass.

This changes the default heartbeat_interval to 60 seconds to more
closely reflect the reality of how often it runs. I also raised the
heartbeat_timeout to 150 seconds since 2.5x interval is a reasonable
production setting for a heartbeat_timeout.

However, in testing, we want tests to fail if a single heartbeat fails,
so I've configured tests to use a timeout of 90 seconds.

Change-Id: I17a270ecbb5fd53149a89816f4be1c9a0c27b541
Closes-Bug: 1295874
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-25 17:10:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/7683a90d1399d07e6888840e14c1b8c771b2efd5', 'message': 'Run periodic_task in a with a dynamic timer

In ironic.common.service, Ironic was running the periodic task loop
every periodic_interval (60s by default) seconds. This means that any
periodic task configured with an interval shorter than periodic_interval
was only getting run every periodic_interval seconds.

This change is twofold:

First, I set the default value for periodic_interval to be 10s, the
minimum interval for any periodic tasks in our default configuration.

Second, I reconfigured periodic tasks to run in a dynamic loop, where
now the periodic task loop will run every min(periodic_interval,
next_run) seconds.

In the case of a misconfiguration, the impact is greatly lessened: only
the first run of a periodic task would have to wait at most
periodic_interval seconds, then afterwards the loop will run more often
to permit it to run at the proper interval.

Closes-Bug: 1295874

commit_message:
Run periodic_task in a with a dynamic timer

In ironic.common.service, Ironic was running the periodic task loop
every periodic_interval (60s by default) seconds. This means that any
periodic task configured with an interval shorter than periodic_interval
was only getting run every periodic_interval seconds.

I reconfigured periodic tasks to run in a dynamic loop, where
now the periodic task loop will run every min(periodic_interval,
next_run) seconds.

Change-Id: I17a270ecbb5fd53149a89816f4be1c9a0c27b541
Closes-Bug: 1295874

commit_message:
simplify heat test_limits

the test_limits test has a lot of conventions from other parts
of tempest which are not needed, like the use of setUpClass, and
setting _interface.

To do this we need to assign a client in the base class, further
refactoring should be able to remove a lot of code from these
tests.

This trims this down to the same functional equivalent, but with
less code.

Change-Id: Iabfa9afb7b55c4cdb86c519bce798e548463e7c4

commit_message:
Revert setting oslo-incubator logs to INFO

Originally oslo-incubator logs were set to INFO because we wanted to
treat oslo-incubator like a library, and we don't want debug logs on for
every single library that we use. In particular the lockutils module has
verbose logs. But this had the side effect of disabling the
processutils debug logs, which are very useful at letting you know when
a something is being shelled out to.

In the short term don't default oslo-incubator logs to INFO. And in the
long run we need to revisit how we set log levels, but that will have to
wait until Juno.

This is a partial revert of: Ia12c003dae196e2220a5f6ea768758a75f2ede23

Change-Id: Icc61964c6a2b002ac1c8566f174e6a5230674c75

commit_message:
Support for specifying nodes for setup-baremetal

As a first step for removing the backwards compatability code in
setup-baremetal, we need it to support both the new and old styles of
specifiying nodes at the same time. To that end, add --nodes support
to setup-baremetal.

Change-Id: Ibd62b17d72032c61627f2a03624223dc979defbd

commit_message:
VMware vSphere: Improve the accuracy of queried samples

Currently we are querying the latest real time sample from vSphere and
creating a sample out of it, in ceilometer. The sampling interval of
real time samples in vSphere is 20 s. However, the interval at which the
various pollsters are run is by default 600 s (10 mins). This CL
attempts to improve the accuracy of the sample by averaging the samples
over the pollster interval.

Change-Id: Id75fe87840b82d7c7d3e4fae9b2fc982e22ea1d7
Implements: blueprint vmware-vcenter-server
Closes-Bug: 1295500

commit_message:
Don't catch all exceptions in image constraint

Just catch ImageNotFound, as otherwise we can hide other problems.

Change-Id: Ib0e813043b1e4fe7b5b4a14ae8130ac17c4355a5
Closes-Bug: #1297349

commit_message:
Verify attributes through Nova "list security groups" API

This patch adds checks whether a response of Nova "list security groups" API
includes the attributes to block the backward incompatibility change
in the future.

The response body of v2 API is the below:
{
    "security_groups": [
        {
            "id": 17,
            "name": "default",
            "tenant_id": "f5e60a2a87ed4a02ae1ab388bdb10cb5",
            "rules": [],
            "description": "default"
        }
    ]
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ibb2cc07e6d723e836b554f08168757aa93f61890

commit_message:
Tell pip to install packages it sees globally

Use pip's option to force installation of packages so that
local copies are installed in the virtualenv, even if they
are present in the global site-packages directory. This
ensures that the latest packages are installed, and that
all of the oslo libraries from namespace packages are
installed in a consistent way, making it possible to run
unit tests on a system where devstack was run previously.

Change-Id: If5c4e12956f2c7be6530c5c9a57fdfb1da8e710c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/82896/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Speed up ironic tests

This change speeds up ironic tests by 60% by:
* Mocking eventlet.greenthread.sleep in a handful of tests
* Changing a time.sleep(2) to time.sleep(0.2) in a test where
  time.sleep is used intentionally for testing

Change-Id: I0cd2ae06549844ec3b76e7c91e1f49665ebc9717
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/80/82680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: time.sleep(0.2)

commit_message:
Enable os-collect-config for the package install

The packaged os-collect-config does not automatically enable the
os-collect-config service, this adds a step to do so.

Change-Id: Ifa536e5e0570ea7c7513f6e722d85ca6776b99a8

commit_message:
Change report_interval from 4 to 30, agent_down_time from 9 to 75

Defaults values changed in neutron upstream to improve performances at
large scale.
Patch in Neutron: http://git.io/U1oCmA

Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Remove logging of exceptions from controller's methods

WSME does exceptions logging in wsmeext.pecan via format_exception()
function. Logging exceptions in Ironic controllers code causes
duplicate messages in log.

Change-Id: Ie5a9856508127557714166d838f0e762e37a611d

subject: Run ipmi power status less aggressively
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-24 23:30:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/8584d0000327e8c54201607587f4983a471e1280', 'message': "Run ipmi power status less aggressively

Ironic runs IPMI 'power status' in a loop until the desired state is
reached. Running repeated IPMI commands in a tight loop (1 second sleep)
seems to occasionally cause 'insufficient resources' errors with some
hardware types.

In this commit we update the IPMI retry timer to use a
DynamicLoopingCall which can wait longer for each retry of the power
status command. We increase the wait time exponentially
between each call, until the total time would exceed the max retry time
on the next iteration.

This patch also removes the spurious initial 'power status' call which
preceeded the 'power on' or 'power off' call without any gap. Since
Ironic has a periodic task to sync the power state, it is safe to assume
that the hardware's current power state is already known and does not
need to be verified inside the set_power_state method.

As part of this change we also increase the default IPMI retry_timeout
config to 60 seconds.

Co-authored-by: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie0e29239592bb64c7a10ecedae299df2c5053359
Closes-bug: #1291991

commit_message:
Run ipmi power status less aggressively

Ironic runs IPMI 'power status' in a loop until the desired state is
reached. Running repeated IPMI commands in a tight loop (1 second sleep)
seems to occasionally cause 'insufficient resources' errors with some
hardware types.

In this commit we update the IPMI retry timer to use a
DynamicLoopingCall which can wait longer for each retry of the power
status command. We increase the wait time exponentially
between each call, until the total time would exceed the max retry time
on the next iteration.

This patch also removes the spurious initial 'power status' call which
preceeded the 'power on' or 'power off' call without any gap. Since
Ironic has a periodic task to sync the power state, it is safe to assume
that the hardware's current power state is already known and does not
need to be verified inside the set_power_state method.

As part of this change we also increase the default IPMI retry_timeout
config to 60 seconds.

Co-authored-by: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie0e29239592bb64c7a10ecedae299df2c5053359
Closes-bug: #1291991

commit_message:
Revert "Add validation to KeyPair resource"

This reverts commit 6124fdea6552145ec38817bbd409b81d717be1c2.

Nova Keypair validation doesn't work with stack-update.  Validation will
fail even if the Nova Keypair resource wasn't changed.

Change-Id: Iaa17e97ca7847c344aabd46f62ae3068cfbbe061
Closes-Bug: #1296747

commit_message:
get_file: encode non utf-8 encoding files via base64

So get_file can support binary file(zip, tgz), non utf-8 encoding
text(gb18030, utf16) files and utf-8 encoding files.

zip and tgz files may be used in chef cookbooks support.

Closes-Bug: #1284501

Change-Id: I72d9bc366f5a94c3c297cb8915ae7b0aa63a34d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/43/76443/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
get_file: do not read same url once again

Since for same url, the content is same. We just need to reuse the
content get_file read first time. No need to read it again.

Change-Id: I08bdb3e953e5ed44674d6adb18efb7ac2fbcd18e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/82/80882/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if str_url not in files: try: files[str_url] = urlutils.urlopen(str_url).read() except urlutils.URLError: raise exc.CommandError('Could not fetch contents for %s' % str_url)
deleted_lines: try: files[str_url] = urlutils.urlopen(str_url).read() except urlutils.URLError: raise exc.CommandError('Could not fetch contents for %s' % str_url)

commit_message:
bind_host got deprecated for admin_bind_host

If admin_bind_host is restricted to something else
than 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1, the keystone manifest fails
since the client tries to connect to 127.0.0.0 -
which is not bound:

(/Stage[main]/Keystone::Roles::Admin/Keystone_role[_member_]) \
Could not evaluate: Execution of '/usr/bin/keystone --os-endpoint \
http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0/ role-list' returned 1: Unable to establish \
connection to http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0/OS-KSADM/roles

Change-Id: I7b13410670b479a004ed69609a03a1140f6939c7

commit_message:
Update the template to ask about data model changes

Changes which require modifications to the data model
often have a wider impact on the system.  The community
often has strong opinions on how the data model should
be evolved, from both a functional and performance
perspective, and disagreements and/or rework late in the
implemetaion stage are vrey disruptive and tiem consuming.
It is therefore important to capture and gain agreement
as early as possible on any proposed changes to the data
model.

Change-Id: I071043c7ce29bb8a47a9da9fb458befe91f6a609

What will a Nova admin now be able to do (or not do) after this change?Data model impact ----------------- What new data objects and/or database schema changes is this going to require? How will the initial set of new data objects be generated, for example if you need to take into account existing instances, or modify other existing data describe how that will work. - Is this a change that takes immediate effect after its merged, or is it something that has to be explicitly enabled? - What new policy items are being added?

commit_message:
Add subnets as a dependency for router

Because router's external gateway depends on at least one external subnet,
so add subnets as an implicit dependency for the router.

Change-Id: Ib34636b440b3eee3993cd1030dab23312824510d
Closes-Bug:1279645
